alert.note: Alert for Calloway; Graves; Marshall; McCracken (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 12 at 9:36AM EST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of western Kentucky, including the following counties, Calloway, Graves, Marshall and McCracken. * WHEN...Until 1230 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 834 AM CST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. There have been a few reports of ponding on roadways near Paducah and Murray. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Paducah, Murray, Mayfield, Metropolis, Benton, Calvert City, Reidland, Lone Oak, Sedalia, Lynnville, West Paducah, Barkley Regional Airport, Wingo, Hardin, Hazel, Water Valley, Brewers, Kirksey, Symsonia and Harris Grove.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
